review: 1st time I plugged it in it worked great. Then after a few days it froze up completely. Totally didn't respond to the remote. I finally unplugged it to see if it would reboot when I plugged it back in. It won't work and won't hook up to my wireless. I have many devices on wireless and it has a strong signal and all the rest work fine. The fire tv stick just won't connect. For me a waste of money and I will stick with Roku 3 which always works great.

review: I was confused between chrome cast and Fire TV stick. So I bought both.Why I needed this stick? - Because I wanted to share content from my mobile/pc to TV and I want to play content from youtube and other sitesFire TV1. Setup took a long time as it downloaded the new software2. No proper instruction on how to share content (local content) from mobile to TV.3. It has inbuilt games which can be played4. No proper instruction on how to share content (local content) from laptop to TV. Plex can do it.Chrome Cast1. Setup was easy2. Needed to download 3rd party software for sharing content (local content) from mobile to TV.3. No games4. No proper instruction on how to share content (local content) from laptop to TV. You can do who screen casting. But it is slow.Common1. Both the device can do casting from youtube2. Both the device doesnt have in house application to share content from mobile/PC to TVVerdict: I preferred fire tv stick as it has no mobile or external device dependency for playing content in TV.

review: After hours of testing I've found out the remote for the FireTv Stick messes with my Vizio E390i-B0 39" TV. Once it happens once it just continues until I removed the batteries & let it set for awhile. I can use the remote for a short amount of time before it start messing with my Vizio tv & trying to turn it off. I used the Android remote app & that works fine for hours, but once I try the supplied remote it's nothing but problems. Very disappointing because the main reason I got it was for the physical remote so family members wouldn't have to mess around with a smartphone.

author: Patrick Gadde

review: Pros- Inexpensive- Responsive- Simple remote- Able to sideload Kodi (XBMC), ES File Explorer, and VLCCons- Plagued with WiFi issues, one of my Sticks disconnects daily and the others 2-3 times a week. Requires reboot to restore WiFi. Tip, hold the select (round button in center) button and play/pause button down together for 10 seconds to reboot to avoid having to unplug all the time.- Remote buttons are clicky and louder than Fire TV remote, so much so that it tends to wake the wife up if I don't soften the sound with pillow.- No Vudu app, if you have a sizable Ultraviolet collection you can't access it with Vudu, you can access some of it with Flixter app but it has terrible picture/audio quality compared to Vudu's HDX format.
